thread.title: Rams receive two compensatory draft choices, will keep 3rd-round pick
thread.title_full: Rams receive two compensatory draft choices, will keep 3rd-round pick

title: Rams receive two compensatory draft choices, will keep 3rd-round pick
text:
Rams receive two compensatory draft choices, will keep 3rd-round pick Rams receive two compensatory draft choices, will keep 3rd-round pick By Bryan Kalbrosky 10 hours ago 250 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 10 hours ago 
The Los Angeles Rams were one of sixteen franchises given compensatory draft picks by the NFL today, which is big news for the Titans trade. 
The Rams will receive the 36th pick in the 3rd round (No. 100 overall) and the 35th pick in the 4th round (No. 141 overall) because they lost “more or better compensatory free agents” than they acquired last season. As many of you know, the Rams' third-round comp pick will go to the Titans, which completes last year's trade up to No. 1 overall. 
— Myles Simmons (@MylesASimmons) February 24, 2017 
Here’s why this is significant news, according to the press release ( via NFL Communications ): 
“Compensatory picks may be traded this year. A rule change approved by clubs in 2015 permits compensatory draft picks to be traded beginning in 2017.” 
The Rams lost Nick Fairley, Janoris Jenkins, Janoris and Rodney McLeod in free agency. 
Only the Cincinnati Bengals, Cleveland Browns, Denver Broncos, Kansas City Chiefs and Miami Dolphins received more compensatory draft picks than the Rams did.
